alert.note: Alert for Ballard (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 19 at 10:09AM EDT until July 19 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR KEVIL KENTUCKY... The National Weather Service in Paducah has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Pulaski County in southern Illinois... Central Ballard County in western Kentucky... * Until 100 PM CDT. * At 909 AM CDT, trained weather spotters reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Ballard and Pulaski Counties. There is widespread flooding with many roads impassable across both counties. Flash flooding is already occurring. This is a FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY for Kevil Kentucky. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! Life threatening flash flooding of low water crossings, small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... La Center, Mounds, Barlow, Mound City, Karnak, Ullin, Kevil, Olmsted, New Grand Chain and Pulaski. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CATASTROPHIC
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now! This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
